snippet: Four months after a spasm of religious violence in the state of Uttar Pradesh, an estimated 15,000 displaced Muslims remain in tent cities, not believing it is safe to return.
abstract: Thousands of Muslims who fled their villages during two-day spasm of religious violence in India's northern state of Uttar Pradesh remain in makeshift tent cities, refusing to return home despite officials' assurances of safety.

byline.original: By ELLEN BARRY and BETWA SHARMA

lead_paragraph: Four months after a spasm of religious violence in the state of Uttar Pradesh, an estimated 15,000 displaced Muslims remain in tent cities, not believing it is safe to return.

headline.main: After Fleeing Violence, Many Indian Muslims Refuse to Return Home
headline.print_headline: Despite Vows of Safety, Many Muslims Won’t Go Home After India Religious Strife
